review_title: The Best Staff I Have Ever Worked With
pros: Phoenixville Hospital was a great place to work. Many of the staff have spent decades of their entire career there proving their commitment to the community. This is a great place for new graduates to gain great experience and learn from the experienced staff. I loved all of the Department Directors who often rolled up their sleeves to help staff when needed. Mostly, I loved that the leadership team was present and visible for the staff often rounding on night and weekend shifts to show a presence and check in. The cafeteria food was excellent, free parking and conveniently located in a vibrant and inclusive town. There is a nursing director who regularly bakes homemade treats and brings her treat cart around for the staff to enjoy. The support groups that the hospital offers to the community members are fantastic including disease management. The clinical ladder program for nurses and the shared governance were also fantastic. The tuition reimbursement for nursing degrees was the best around. The vacation time was generous.
cons: Competition in this area is a major reason for turnover with so many excellent healthcare systems in the greater Philadelphia area.

pros: Small Town Hospital, everyone is super friendly.
cons: Worried they may close their doors or be bought out.
